result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald P. Skipper

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:03 am 
INCLUDES 15CF576, 15CF959, AND 14CM2040. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person with Atty Pauline Toulouse.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF576: Ct. 1 (Fail/Maintain Sex Offender Registry/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Fail/Maintain Sex Offender Registry/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF959: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>DELETE Repeater enhancer. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Sex Registry Violation/Repeater)>>DELETE Repeater enhancer. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Sex Registry Violation/Repeater)>>DELETE Repeater enhancer and D&RI. 
In 14CM2040: Ct. 3 (Issue of Worthless Checks/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                       : Ct. 4 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF959: Amended Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Amended Ct. 2 (Sex Registry Violation)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 14CM2040: Ct. 1 (Theft by Contractor/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                       : Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CF959: Cts. 1 & 2>>SWH for 3 years probation- CONDITION: DNA sample and surcharge. 
In 14CM2040: Cts. 1 & 2>>SWH for 2 years probation. 
COURT ORDERS all sentences to run concurrent. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of probation on ALL>>assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept including Corrective Thinking Class and Financial Budget Class; comply with sex offender registry law; letter of apology to C.D. and D.D.; no contact with C.D. and D.D. unless authorized by agent; pay restitution of $5208 at a rate of at least $250 per month; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; CC. 

COURT finds the def is entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked. 
COURT authorizes transfer of probation to def's county of residence. 

Adj: 9:24 am

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

15CF959 - Initial appearance: 
Atty Toulouse is waiving reading and time limits. Address correct 
State is requesting signature bond and deft to comply with sex offender registry
COURT authorizes $2500 signautre bond and deft to comply with sex offender registry

15CF576 - Contested Preliminary Hearing:
Sue Klemann from WI Dept of Corrections Sex Registry Program is sworn in and testifies - identifies defendant
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed. 

Dates set: with Br 1 JA
Bond:  Continued

Adj: 9:20am
